context_meta.title: The Rockets won the game the Wolves had to steal, thanks to James Harden

context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: Sunday's NBA playoffs: Pacers stun Cavs, LeBron
context_meta.summary: Cleveland — LeBron James figured he had experienced everything in 12 postseasons. Turns out, there was something new. Victor Oladipo scored 32 points and Indiana outplayed Cleveland from the start while pulling off a stunning 98-80 victory Sunday in the series opener, handing James and the Cavaliers' their first loss in the opening round in eight years. It also was the first playoff-opening loss for James, who came in 12-0 in Game 1s and didn't realize he had been perfect starting the postseason. “Is it?” James said. “I've never lost a game in the first round before in my career? But while he knows the narrative before Wednesday's Game 2 will be on the struggles of Cleveland's playoff newcomers,

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: "Playoff P" Paul George scores 36, leads Thunder past Jazz
context_meta.summary: On Saturday, Thunder forward Paul George told reporters about an alter-ego he calls ''Playoff P.'' On Sunday, he gave the media, his teammates and the Utah Jazz a formal introduction. ''That's his new name?'' seemingly perplexed teammate Carmelo Anthony asked with a smile. George lived up to it.

context_meta.author: ipostwhaticareabout
context_meta.title: Harden's step-back move had fans shouting travel
context_meta.summary: James Harden is one of the NBA's most dynamic scorers and the favorite to win MVP this season. He's a challenge for any player to defend, and when he's getting away with the move below, he's impossible. During Game 1 of the Rockets' first-round matchup with the Timberwolves, Harden broke down Andrew Wiggins off the dribble and knocked down a step-back 3. The footwork was incredible. It was also a blatant travel. Harden took four steps back after he picked up his dribble. It was done quickly, and it wasn't called. NBA fans certainly took notice, though. They all had the same reaction. But let's be realistic - no NBA ref is going to call that a travel. They even let this one go.

context_meta.author: captainunderoos
context_meta.title: James Harden Erupts for 44 Points as Rockets Beat Jimmy Butler, Timberwolves
context_meta.summary: James Harden apparently isn't slowing down in the playoffs after an incredible regular season.  The Houston Rockets star scored 44, including 13 in the fourth quarter, to help the No. 1 seed in the West survive with a 104-101 Game 1 win over the Minnesota Timberwolves.  Andrew Wiggins scored 18 for the Timberwolves in their first playoff game in 14 years, but it wasn't enough to keep up with Harden and the Rockets offense. This article will be updated to provide more information on this story as it becomes available.

context_meta.title: Lakers Hold 25th Overall Pick In First Round Of 2018 NBA Draft
context_meta.summary: At this year's trade deadline the Los Angeles Lakers pulled off a deal that sent Larry Nance Jr. and Jordan Clarkson to the Cleveland Cavaliers. In exchange the Lakers received Isaiah Thomas, Channing Frye, and Cleveland's 2018 first-round pick. Much of the focus initially was on the acquisition of Thomas, a lifelong Lakers fan who had interest in joining the team as a free agent in 2014. Additionally, there was a lot of attention paid to the amount of salary cap space the Lakers created with the deal, but considering the team's recent draft history, that first-round pick is huge. context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: How Lance Stephenson made an impact, literally, against LeBron James in Game 1
context_meta.summary: Lance Stephenson didn't waste any time making an impact in the Indiana Pacers' series against the Cleveland Cavaliers. He gave LeBron James a really hard (but common) foul, drove for a monster dunk (and head-butted the basket support), hit a corner 3-pointer and more -- and that was all in the first quarter. Lance had 9 points and 4 rebounds as the Pacers led 55-38 at halftime. Stephenson clubbed James on the head late in the third quarter. Lance gets a personal foul and a technical foul, but it's not a flagrant foul. Stephenson finished with 12 points and 5 rebounds in Indiana's 98-80 win. context_meta.title: The Knicks-Mike Woodson interest is officially mutual
context_meta.summary: Former Knicks coach Mike Woodson got his wish. One day after telling The Post he would “love” to interview with the Knicks to “finish what I started,” team brass received permission from the Clippers on Sunday to talk to Doc Rivers' top assistant, according to a league source who confirmed an ESPN report. Woodson was arguably their best coach since Jeff Van Gundy, who resigned in 2001. He has been with Los Angeles since Phil Jackson fired him following the 2013-14 season and finished with a Knicks career record of 109-79. He has worked with both Knicks president Steve Mills and GM Scott Perry in the past. Woodson's final season in New York was under Mills' watch, and he was with Perry in Detroit

context_meta.title: Denver Nuggets' offseason storylines include Nikola Jokic's max contract, Will Barton's free agency
context_meta.summary: Michael Malone and Tim Connelly echoed the same sentiment. The Nuggets' coach and president of basketball operations are sick of holding their final media gathering right after the conclusion of the regular season. “How many times can you be the bridesmaid?” Connelly said Friday, less than two days after the Nuggets lost an overtime heartbreaker at Minnesota in their regular-season finale. Despite finishing with a 46-36 record, Denver missed the playoffs by one game for the second consecutive season. context_meta.title: Gregg Popovich goes full Gregg Popovich in postgame press conference
context_meta.summary: Gregg Popovich wasn't in the mood to speak with the media following the Spurs' 21-point loss to the Warriors in the first round of the NBA Playoffs on Saturday. The coach started his postgame press conference with a "joke" about a bottle of Gatorade being on the table and then claimed he "was so tired of this" as he asked for questions.  “[This is] supposed to be here? What if I don't like this? There's too much sugar and all that kind of stuff. I don't want to promote that… I'm just teasing, jeez. Have a sense of humor, will yah? context_meta.summary: SportsPulse: USA TODAY Sports' NBA experts break down the key story lines heading into the Western Conference playoffs. OAKLAND – The champs stayed off the ropes. When it comes to the ailing Golden State Warriors and their quest for a third title in four years, that was the main takeaway from Game 1 of their first-round playoff series against San Antonio at Oracle Arena on Saturday. After all that discussion about how they were in trouble, how losing 10 of 17 games amid all those injuries to close the regular season meant they just might get Buster Douglas-ed right at the start, they came out swinging instead with a 113-92 win. context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Ira Winderman: Heat survive Part I of Dragic payment plan
context_meta.summary: When it comes to draft-pick preservation and dissemination, the Miami Heat have done a solid job of limiting the pain in recent years, doing so again this season with this playoff berth against the Philadelphia 76ers. As a result, if there is to be any residual sting from the February 2015 acquisition of Goran Dragic from the Phoenix Suns, it isn't likely to be particularly unsettling this June. – In 2015, when the Heat stood to lose their first-round pick to the 76ers if it wasn't in the top 10, they attempted to put together a season-ending loss for the ages, playing Michael Beasley, Henry Walker, James Ennis and Tyler Johnson all 48 minutes, in a game they still won but benefited by outside results to protect their bottom-10 standing.

context_meta.summary: GETTY The 33-year-old took the Wine & Gold to NBA Championship glory two years ago but Cleveland were convincingly beaten in last year's finals by the Golden State Warriors. The Cavs are a weaker team this year than last after losing Kyrie Irving and their defensive efficiency has come under scrutiny throughout the regular season, where they ended as the Eastern Conference's fourth seed. Meanwhile the Pacers, who lost 4-0 to James and co. at this stage of the post-season last year, established themselves as an energetic offensive outfit in 2017-18. context_meta.author: nanook
context_meta.title: Ben Simmons takes over NBA Playoffs on first try as 76ers scorch Heat in Game 1
context_meta.summary: Ben Simmons is a rookie. But in his playoff debut, Simmons apparently didn't get the memo. The 21-year-old, 6-foot-10 point guard and the 76ers dominated the Heat 130-103 Saturday in Game 1 of their first-round playoff series. Simmons finished with 17 points, 14 rebounds, and nine rebounds while the 76ers rolled. He also did what any good point guard should and that is find his shooters. Sharpshooting reserves Marco Belinelli and Ersan Ilyasova combined for 42 points while Simmons diced apart the Miami defense with his passing. Next to him, JJ Redick poured in 23 points himself. context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: How did Kobe Bryant help Sixers' Marco Belinelli hit those crazy 3-pointers in romp over Miami Heat
context_meta.summary: PHILADELPHIA -- They both speak Italian. They both have hit more than their share of crazy off-balance shots. They both have won NBA championships. But only one of them is still playing. The story of how Marco Belinelli learned to make 3-pointers that are not found anywhere on the degree-of-difficulty scale is actually a story about a kid growing up in Italy who dreamed of one day making it to the NBA, and one day being like Kobe Bryant -- a guy who had his own Philly and Italy connections. "There's a couple of great shooters from Italy, too, but I always dreamed of becoming a player like Kobe Bryant or Michael Jordan when I was young," said Belinelli.
